item.title: Report I-2024110052
item.description:
Report I-2024110052

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-11T01:07:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: San Francisco
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 293807
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Near completion of boarding Flight 2045 a customefs HP Laptop went into thermal runaway in their backpack under the seat near the back of the aircraft. Flames were issuing from the bag as the lithium ion batteries flared. The cabin of the aircraft quickly filled with smoke. The customefs father removed backpack from underseat and successfully bypassed the Flight Attendant and her commands in the aft of the cabin and threw the backpack with flaming laptop out onto the rampat San Francisco(SFO) International airport through one of the aft aircraft emergency exit doorways. Customers were panicking to evacuate. Flight Attendants opened 3 emergency exits on the aircraft and some customers exited slides onto the ramp below while others egressed through the main cabin door back onto the jetway and into the terminal.

item.description:
Report X-2024120477

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-10T12:24:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-07
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME FROM LOADSIDE WET AND LEAKING. NO MARKINGS ON OUTER PACKAGE INDICATING SHIPPING STATUS OF GOODS. SIX PACK POINT OF SALE TRAY IN SHRINK WRAP. ONE CAN LEAKED FROM DEPRESSED BUTTON. ONE CAN WITH BROKEN CAP AND STEM. ALL GOODS SOILED. SPILL COLLECTED WITH ABSORBENT MATERIALS. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2024120384
item.description:
Report X-2024120384

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-03
  • City: ONTARIO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: TWO AIR PACKAGES WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH AND HAD FROST FORMING ON THE BOTTOM SIDES OF THE BOXES. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATLEY FOUR POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING DOG FOOD. EACH BOX ALSO HAS TWO PACKS OF NON-REGULATED NORDIC ICE PACKS. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO THE SAME CONSIGNEE IS 1ZHJ22880224368262. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES.

item.title: Report E-2024120051
item.description:
Report E-2024120051

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: ADELANTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0456 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UAD. It was reported that approximately 5 gallons of White Pigmented Shellac Primer was released from a 5-gallon plastic pail due to a forklift puncture by UAD. The release impacted the concrete at dock door 93. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. Called Chemtrec and spoke to Greg. Report #2024110700029. Product was containerized to (1) 55-gallon DF contains a 5-gallon plastic pail of White Pigmented Shellac Primer and oil Dri.
